name: Hotel Alexandra

reviews.text: We stayed there as a party of 8, the rooms are clean but need updating and the breakfast is good. The staff are all very friendly and go out of their way to help you.
reviews.title: Friendly and welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location for exploring the city.Hotel was quiet-guests and generally.Room was small but clean enough and the double windows did block out the noise from the main road outside.Some good bars and restaurants nearby and handy for getting the bus back to the airport.
reviews.title: Central location

reviews.text: Nice little hotel. Staff were great and location couldn't have been better. Stayed in a basic room which was a little basic but clean and pleasant.
reviews.title: Fab location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned rooms are really hot so if you have a room facing the main road and want a window open expect to be woken at regular interviews by passers by and traffic.
reviews.title: Highly recommend
Great for Danish design fans
reviews.text: The 'boutique' style of the hotel suited us. Staff always friendly and helpful. Enjoyed a welcome home glass of wine one evening and a pleasant meal in the small restaurant on another, assisted with our 'green saver' vouchers. (A great idea!) Size-wise the room was on a par with experiences in Amsterdam, Paris or London and had everything we needed when not out exploring Copenhagen. Proximity to station and city attractions enables walking at all hours. A bonus. Great value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a 'Danish Retro Double Room' and were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Great stay in this stylish hotel

reviews.text: Bright and airey with good quality fittings and a large shower.
reviews.title: disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was on the 3rd floor facing onto the side road but still near the main road.
reviews.title: the best location bossibile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was noisey with the windows open but perhaps not unexpected in such a central position. The noise was effectively eliminated by the effective secondary double glazing if desired.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was excellent and possibly the most comfortable matress we have had.
reviews.title: A great boutique hotel, check bed size.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice and clean right in the middle of Copenhagen, 2 mins walk from Tivoli. Small rooms but efficiently furnished with Danish retro designer furniture. Make sure you get a room facing the quite courtyard as I can imagine C.H. Anders Bvld can be quite noisy early in the morning. We never took the breakfast although it seemed a good deal for 99 dkr in expensive Copenhagen. Nice touch was the free glass of red wine offered by the concierge after 10pm.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in good location

reviews.text: Stayed there for a weekend trip with friends. The rooms were small and full of ugly furniture. I know they are supposed to be classic Danish design pieces, but that did not help. They were dirty and old. I prefer to have non-classics that do not hurt my eyes. Otherwise than this and the tiny size it was ok. At least it is close to the center.
reviews.title: Ugly and outdated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is fine and clean. Only drawback was that our room does not have drawers but shelves only. You don't want your undies on display. Do you? Maybe the furniture designer didn't design a drawer.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay, convenient and clean.
We loved it and we'll be back!
reviews.text: Hotel is only 5 minutes walk from the central station and many bus lines run around the hotel. Most of the major attractions are within walking distance.
One caution, they charge you a few percent for the use of credit card. Rate varies depending on which card you use.
reviews.title: Great design room

reviews.text: A lovely hotel with a great location - just a little walk away from the trainstation, several buslines, Tivoli and "Strøget" shopping area. I would say that the design part that they say so much about is a bit overrated...! Anyhow, the room was simple and clean. (Bathroom tiny!!) Just OK. It was located on the corner, so we were disturbed quite a lot but the traffic both cars and people out on Saturday night. door at a café. I thought breakfast was expensive, so we ate a few steps away at a café - very nice. They served a little snack in the reseption area between lunsch and dinner and when buying tickets for the Tivoli at the hotel you get a discount.
reviews.title: Location excellent, but then of course a bit noisy.

reviews.text: Hotel was a great place to stay when visiting Copenhagen. We stayed the day before our cruise. It is within walking distance to many attractions including Tivoli Gardens. It is very clean and the price is very reasonable.
reviews.title: great location and price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were worried about the location near to a busy road but once inside the hotel foyer there was no need. Quiet and with an elegant scandinavian style we felt at home from start. We're not talking new style, but retro from 40ies and 50ies with just the right furniture. The room wasn't large but with ample seeling hight it felt airy. Breakfast was extra but well worth it. A small minus on no bacon being available and also the scrambled eggs were of the very dry type - think they make it from some sort of powder. Perfect location near to Tivoli, Central station and Stroeget.
reviews.title: A neat hotel with Danish style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other reviews are pretty helpful--it's not the Ritz, but very clean, rooms are sufficient, it's centrally located, and the staff is great. We stored 3 large suitcases for the day, and had no problems. We will stay here again.
reviews.title: Good value in an expensive city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located to the main train station and to the city attractions. The service was very good and helpful. I was a bit disappointed with the room. It was an interior with two beds and in between there was a desk. It all seemed very old and need of some TLC. But for the price I guess it is what you get in CPH. It is not a modern hotel so do not expect that. They did have bicicles for rent which was very nice and friendly.
reviews.title: OK hotel

description: The Hotel is beautifully decorated with classical Retro-Danish furniture Design, and the hotel's 100 year old walls are dressed in modern Danish art - here you will find a sight for sore eyes! Perfectly situated right next to Europe's largest pedestrian street and the Tivoli Gardens.
